intro: Palicourea rosea, commonly known as the pink piper or pink sarsaparilla, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its attractive, fragrant pink or white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly waxy texture. Palicourea rosea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
